content: the ironwood hat the ironwood tree holds a special place in my heart i grew up in a secluded area on the canadian shield on ironwood lane my childhood was spent playing amongst the great pines the wise oaks and the ironwoods although the ironwood tree is sometimes overlooked it is a tree that should not go unnoticed the ironwood is strong and stands tall under the oak and pine trees noursihing the animals of the forest let us learn from the ironwood tree and move throughout life with confidence resilience and kindness and to do so without recognition purl and pine knits / ironwood hat details size one size fits most this hat is meant to be worn with 2-4 negative ease finished brim measurement is 20 fits head circumference of 22 to 24 finished 20 circumference and 7 - 8 from top to bottom measurement bulky or super bulky weight yarn 73m 80yds yarn suggested yarn bernat softee chunky yarn 110g/99m 3 5oz/108yds ribbing 6 mm/us 10 24 circular needle or preferred needles suggested for working in the round or 6 mm/us 10 dpn needle main fabric 8 mm/us 11 24 circular needle or preferred needles for working in the round or 8 mm/11 dpn gauge 10 5 stitches x 16 row measure over stockinette stitch in the round to create a 4 x 4 gauge swatch notions tapestry needle marker scissors measuring tape abbreviations co cast on pm place marker k knit p - purl dpn - double pointed needles purl and pine knits / ironwood hat directions pt 1 cast on with smaller needles co 52 stitches using the long tail co or preferred method pm and join to work in the round being careful not to twist your stitches pt 2 brim/ribbing row 1 k1 p1 repeat to end of round/marker row 2 knit to end of round/marker repeat row 1 & 2 to create the broken rib stitch continue in this pattern until brim measures 2 inches pt 3 body with larger needles knit in the round until hat measures 7 5 - 8 5 inches from the co edge or until desired length tip the finished hat will be 1/2 shorter than the length knit if you knit to 8 5 the finished hat measurement will be 8 from top to bottom pt 4 the finish cut your yarn leaving at least an 8-inch tail with a tapestry needle thread the yarn through the stitches on your needle dropping each stitch off your needle as you go once all stitches are off the needle pull the yarn tight due to the large number of stitches there will be a gap use the remaining tail to weave and close in the gap weave in all tails block if desired purl and pine knits / ironwood hat the best way to multiply your happiness is to share it with others -
